paperContext.title: Liquidity Withdrawal Precedes Price Shocks: Evidence from Cryptocurrency Futures
paperContext.coreContribution: Empirical evidence that liquidity changes precede price shocks at statistically significant rates in crypto futures markets

userStories.title: Create paper skeleton with full section structure
userStories.description: Set up the paper directory structure and create main.md with all sections, target word counts, and placeholder content.
acceptanceCriteria: Include target word counts for each section

userStories.title: Write Abstract (200 words)
userStories.description: Draft a compelling abstract that clearly states problem, method, result, and implication in Anthropic style.
acceptanceCriteria: States the problem: understanding price shock genesis
Summarizes method: event detection + onset timing
Reports key result: 44% vs 33% null, p < 10^-5

userStories.title: Write Introduction section
userStories.description: Write the introduction motivating the problem, stating the research question, and listing contributions.
acceptanceCriteria: Motivates: price shocks matter, understanding genesis is valuable

userStories.title: Write Data section
userStories.description: Document data sources, date selection rationale, and provide summary statistics.
acceptanceCriteria: States data source (Binance USD-M Futures, data.binance.vision)
Explains date selection strategy (high volatility days)
Includes data summary table (dates, events per day, etc.)

userStories.title: Write Methods section
userStories.description: Formalize the methodology with equations, algorithms, and clear definitions.
acceptanceCriteria: Event detection: threshold-based price shock definition
Onset detection: k×std threshold crossing formalized
Statistical tests: binomial test, bootstrap CI specifications
References Figure showing example event window

userStories.title: Write Results section with statistics
userStories.description: Present the main findings with all statistics and references to figures.
acceptanceCriteria: Shows asset comparison (BTC vs ETH proportions)

userStories.title: Write Discussion section
userStories.description: Interpret findings carefully, address alternative explanations, and connect to theory.
acceptanceCriteria: Interprets finding: what does liquidity-first suggest?
Addresses alternative explanations (latency, threshold artifacts, etc.)
Connects to market microstructure theory (informed trading, market makers)

userStories.title: Write comprehensive Limitations section
userStories.description: Write an honest, comprehensive limitations section matching Anthropic's intellectual honesty style.
acceptanceCriteria: Date selection may bias toward exciting events
Written in first person, directly honest style

userStories.title: Write Related Work section
userStories.description: Survey relevant literature and position this work.
acceptanceCriteria: Position this work in the literature

userStories.title: Write Conclusion section
userStories.description: Write a concise conclusion restating the contribution and future work.

userStories.title: Create publication-quality figures
userStories.description: Generate polished figures for the paper with proper styling.
acceptanceCriteria: Figure 1: Ordering proportions bar chart (styled for publication)
Figure 2: Onset delta histogram (styled for publication)
Figure 3: Example event window showing liquidity/price/volume
All figures have proper axis labels, legends

userStories.title: Final editing and consistency pass
userStories.description: Review the complete paper for consistency, accuracy, and polish.
acceptanceCriteria: Create appendix.md with date list and additional tables
